page.title: 07ST. ANN'S HILL, CHERTSEY
page.content: We went to St. Ann s Hill and Mrs Smart took some photographs. St.Ann s Hill is a contrast to the rest of the surrounding country side which is very flat. There used to be a chapel but it is very odd that not even the ruins can be seen. Charles James Fox, a parliamentarian of the l8th century used to live in a house on the hillside. We climbed up the hill and saw Thorpe Park and Heathrow Airport. We saw a plane taking off. We saw a thick tree with an orange trunk. There was a swing on one of the trees made from a rope and a plastic bag. Everywhere around were lots of rhododendrons.
